preclusion: Students who have been in practice as qualified lawyers in the local or other jurisdictions are precluded.
description:
This clinic will provide students with the eye-opening experience of assisting a seasoned practitioner with the handling of a case under the Legal Assistance Scheme for Capital Offences (LASCO). 

Under guided mentorship clinical students will experience a learning journey that will allow them to gain valuable professional practice skills, and increase their substantive criminal law knowledge. Students may be involved in tasks such as attending client meetings, drafting pleadings and attending court hearings.

Students will be able to help accused individuals when they need it most. The experience may cause students to question their own views on justice, and life!
title: The Capital Offences Criminal Litigation Clinic
prerequisite:
NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent. 
NUS Legal Skills Programme or equivalent, in particular, Legal Analysis, Research and Communication or its equivalent. Singapore Legal System or its equivalent.
